sen.j: 松平 乗寛（まつだいら のりひろ、安永6年12月27日 (旧暦)（1778年1月25日） - 天保10年11月11日 (旧暦)（1839年12月16日））は、江戸時代後期の大名、政治家、老中。
sen.e: Norihiro MATSUDAIRA (male, January 25, 1778 to December 16, 1839) was daimyo (a Japanese territorial lord), a politician, and roju (the person in charge of political affairs directly under shogun) in the late Edo period.
Norihiro MATSUDAIRA (January 25, 1778 - December 16, 1839) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord), politician and roju (member of shogun's council of elders) in the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: male, を削除用語集に統一
sen.e: Norihiro MATSUDAIRA (January 25, 1778 - December 16, 1839) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord), politician and roju (member of shogun's council of elders) in the late Edo period.

sen.j: 三河国西尾藩第3代藩主。
sen.e: He was the third lord of Nishio Domain in Mikawa Province
He was the third lord of Nishio Domain in Mikawa Province
He was the third lord of Nishio Domain in Mikawa Province
He was the eighth house head of the main house of OTAMAU-MATSUDAIRA family
He was the eighth head of Ogyu Matsudaira family
He was the eighth head of Ogyu Matsudaira family
Norihiro was the first son of Norimasa MATSUDAIRA who was the second lord.
Norihiro was the first son of Norisada MATSUDAIRA who was the second lord.
Norihiro was the first son of Norisada MATSUDAIRA who was the second lord.

sen.j: 母は越智松平武元の娘。
sen.e: Norihiro's mother was a daughter of Takemoto KOSHIJI-MATSUDAIRA.
Norihiro's mother was a daughter of Takechika OCHI-MATSUDAIRA.
Norihiro's mother was a daughter of Takechika OCHI-MATSUDAIRA.
Norihiro's formal wife was a daughter of Masatomo ABE.
Norihiro's legal wife was a daughter of Masatomo ABE.
Norihiro's legal wife was a daughter of Masatomo ABE.

sen.j: 子に松平乗全（長男）、牧野忠衛（次男）、牧野忠恭（三男）、松平乗秩（四男）、娘（水野忠義正室）、娘（松平某室）、娘（松平信恵室）がいる。
sen.e: Norihiro's children were Norimasa MATSUDAIRA (the first son), Tadamori MAKINO (the second son), Tadanori MAKINO (the third son), Norichichi MATSUDAIRA (the fourth son), a daughter (the formal wife of Tadayoshi MIZUNO), a daughter (a wife of some person in the MATSUDAIRA family), and a daughter (a wife of Nobue MATSUDAIRA).

Norihiro's children were Noriyasu MATSUDAIRA (the first son), Tadamori MAKINO (the second son), Tadayuki MAKINO (the third son), Noritsune MATSUDAIRA (the fourth son), a daughter (the legal wife of Tadayoshi MIZUNO), a daughter (a wife of some person in the MATSUDAIRA family), and a daughter (a wife of Nobushige MATSUDAIRA).

Norihiro's children were Noriyasu MATSUDAIRA (the first son), Tadamori MAKINO (the second son), Tadayuki MAKINO (the third son), Noritsune MATSUDAIRA (the fourth son), a daughter (the legal wife of Tadayoshi MIZUNO), a daughter (a wife of some person in the MATSUDAIRA family), and a daughter (a wife of Nobushige MATSUDAIRA).

sen.j: 官位は従四位下侍従、和泉国守。
sen.e: Norihiro's official rank was a chamberlain at Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and worked as the governor of Izumi Province.
Norihiro's official court rank was Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Jiju (chamberlain) and Izumi no kuni no kami (governor of Izumi Province).
Norihiro's official court rank was Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Jiju (chamberlain) and Izumi no kuni no kami (governor of Izumi Province).

sen.j: 幕府では寺社奉行を二期勤め、京都所司代を経て老中に就任した。
sen.e: Norihiro worked as the chief of the temple-shrine police for two terms, worked for Kyoto-shoshidai (the office handling affairs concerning the Imperial Court and those in Kinki Region), and was assigned to be roju.
Norihiro served as Jisha Bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines) for two terms and Kyoto Shoshidai (the Kyoto deputy), before was assigned to be roju.
Norihiro served as Jisha Bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines) for two terms and Kyoto Shoshidai (the Kyoto deputy), before was assigned to be roju.

sen.j: 天保10年（1839年）没し、後を長男の乗全が継いだ。
sen.e: Norihiro died in 1839 and Norimasa, his first son, succeeded him.
Norihiro died in 1839 and Noriyasu, his first son, succeeded him.
Norihiro died in 1839 and Noriyasu, his first son, succeeded him.

sen.j: 1809年（文化 (元号)6年） 寺社奉行
sen.e: 1809: The chief of temple-shrine police
1809: Jisha Bugyo.
1809: Jisha Bugyo.
1813: Resigned the chief of temple-shrine police.
1813: Resigned Jisha Bugyo.

sen.j: 1815年（文化12年） 寺社奉行再任
sen.e: 1815: Assigned again to be the chief of temple-shrine police.
1815: Assigned again to be Jisha Bugyo.
1815: Assigned again to be Jisha Bugyo.

sen.j: 1818年（文政元年） 京都所司代
sen.e: 1818: Assigned to be Kyoto-shoshidai.
1818: Assigned to be Kyoto Shoshidai.
1818: Assigned to be Kyoto Shoshidai.
1822: Assigned to be roju.
1822: Assigned to be roju.

Norihiro died at the age of
